verses.roman:
ya etat puṇyam ākhyānaṁ
viṣṇor vīryopabṛṁhitam
kīrtayec chraddhayā śrutvā
karma-pāśair vimucyate

synonyms: yaḥ—anyone who; etat—this; puṇyam—pious; ākhyānam—narration; viṣṇoḥ—of Lord Viṣṇu; vīrya—the supreme power; upabṛṁhitam—in which is described; kīrtayet—chants or repeats; śraddhayā—with great faith; śrutvā—after properly hearing (from the right source); karma-pāśaiḥ—from the bondage of fruitive activities; vimucyate—becomes liberated.
translation: One who hears and chants this narration about the omnipotence of the Supreme Personality of Godhead, Viṣṇu, is certainly liberated from material bondage without fail.
